entry.title: Chimnabai Clock Tower (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chimnabai Clock Tower (pictured) was named after a queen of Baroda State?

entry.title: portrait of T. S. Eliot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Royal Academy of Arts exhibited Wyndham Lewis's portrait of T. S. Eliot in 2018, after having rejected it 80 years earlier?

entry.title: Pyit-Nwe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to the Burmese Razadarit Ayedawbon chronicle, Commander Pyit-Nwe of Myaungmya refused to join the royal service after being defeated in battle, and instead asked to be executed?

entry.title: Across the Board (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on the 1950s game show Across the Board, crossword answers are clued by both a phrase and an image?

entry.title: Ángel Sagaz Zubelzu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Spanish diplomat Ángel Sagaz Zubelzu secured the release of more than 1,500 Jews from prison in Egypt by arguing they were descended from expelled Jews and thus entitled to Spanish citizenship?

entry.title: Once Upon a Studio (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the short film Once Upon a Studio features previously unheard audio from Robin Williams as the Genie?

entry.title: Katherine Henderson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Katherine Henderson led efforts to reverse the gender pay gap in Canadian curling?

entry.title: The Password Game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the creator of The Password Game was unsure whether winning the game was possible before releasing it?
